problem.label: 1. Software that is free to use and modify is called what?
2. Which 2 licenses do the Open edX project use?

checkboxgroup.choice: AGPLv3 Correct, AGPLv3 is one of the licenses the Open edX project uses.
MIT License Sorry, MIT License is not correct, try again.
BSD license Sorry, BSD license is not correct, try again.
Creative Commons licenses Correct, Creative Commons is one of the licenses the Open edX project uses.
No license No license is not correct try again.

problem.label: 3. What knowledge and systems requirements do you need to work on Open edX coding? (Select 2)

checkboxgroup.choice: Basics of coding knowledge of at least one programming language. Correct! To be successful in this course you will need to know the basics of coding.
Computer running Mac OSX (Intel or Apple silicon) or a Linux distribution. Correct! Having a Mac OsX or Linux operating system is crucial for this course.
In depth knowledge of the Open Source Philosophy. Incorrect, you don’t need in-depth knowledge on the Open Source Philosophy. If you would like to learn more take the course Open Source Master Class.

problem.label: 4. What concepts will be taught in this course? (Select 5)

checkboxgroup.choice: Introduction to the technical architecture of the Open edX platform. Correct! We will be covering technical architecture in this course.
How to create and run a development environment. Correct! We will be covering development environments in this course.
The steps to deploy and run your own Open edX instance. Correct! We will be covering deploying an Open edX instance in this course.
How the development on the Open edX project is conducted. Correct! We will be covering how development is conducted in this course.
How to contribute your code back to the main project. Correct! We will be covering Open edX project contributions in this course.

In depth introduction to the Open edX project - including project history, project context, and an overview of the different roles for Core Contributors. Incorrect, you can find this information in the course Intro to the Open edX Project and Contributing.

Programming concepts and one or more programming languages. Selected: Incorrect, we assume you know programming concepts and languages before you take this course. In Module 6: Reference Material, Tutorials and How-Tos, we provide resources for getting up to speed with our primary languages, frameworks, and technologies.
